page.title: 17The Fire Brigade Interview
page.content: We interviewed Mr Ben Woolley the Station Officer at Abergavenny Fire Station.Mr Woolley told us that he started as a fireman in 1956.Mr Woolley also works at the hospital.We asked him how his job had changed.He told us that a new fire station had been built in 1983 which was in a better position. When a 999 call is made the Fire Brigade are now informed by a computer. Details of the fire are sent to the fire station by the computer and we were shown the printer.The two engines can be on their way to a fire about 3 minutes.There are about 300 call-outs a year.In one of the engines we were shown the breathing sets used by the firemen to enter smokey buildings. We very much enjoyed our visit to the Fire Station.
